results.title: Spring ball
results.brief_description: Occasion, memory and friendship. A country community comes together for its annual Senior Citizens Spring Ball. Starring 90 senior citizens from Wagga Wagga.

results.title: Spring's wild splendours
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman G. Green
results.brief_description: Springtime, the wildflower season in Western Australia. Among the many flowering shrubs and plants are everlasting, leschenaultia, hovea, quandong, kangaroo paws and Sturt’s desert pea as well as the Christmas tree, several species of banksia and flowering eucalyptus.

results.title: Spring
results.brief_description: Provides a series of visual impressions illustrating spring. Shows bare trees bursting into leaf, buds into flower and a profusion of colour appearing in gardens. No narration.

results.title: Spread your wings: making it with TAFE
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films, Technical and Further Education, Chris Stewart and John O'Shea
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film which is intended to provide information about the opportunities offered by Technical and Further Education in vocational training, and in recreational courses to meet community requirements. It is not intended to give detailed information on the breadth of courses and curricula but is rather a stimulus film aimed at encouraging enrolment.

results.title: Spotty: the fawn in winter
results.brief_description: Shows Spotty the fawn as he sees his first snow in the forest, and describes how a little girl who puts out food for the animals helps Spotty survive his first winter.

results.title: Spotty: story of a fawn
results.brief_description: The story of the adventures of a wild fawn is used to foster a love of nature and outdoor life among young children. The film was shot in the natural environment of the fawn in the woods of North America and is aimed at stimulating oral and written language development at the kindergarten level.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Meridian Films, Smiley Films, Richard Brennan, Timothy White and Mark Joffe
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!
